content.question: Which of the following is an accurate explanation of an advantage of executive term limits?

choices.label: Executive term limits allow legislators to develop coherent policies over time.
Executive term limits allow executives greater control over the legislative process.
Executive term limits can prevent executives from consolidating power.
Executive term limits can weaken accountability.

content.answer: Executive term limits can prevent executives from consolidating power.
